result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER in court, in custody.  Attorney David W. Field in court for JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 
21CT21, Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
21CF466, Amended Count 1, OWI 3, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
21CF466, Count 5, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
22CF142, Count 1, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining charges DRI. 21CF467, Uncharged DA case 21CH1111, 21TR881, 22CF116, & 22CF194 DRI.

Court orders: 

21CT21, Count 1
$1550 fine
$36.40 BAC
20 days jail, Huber, 15 days credit
16 mo dl rev, retroactive
12 mo IID, half price
AODA/DSP 

21CF466, Count 1
$2450 fine
$36.40 BAC
80 days jail, 1 day credit, Huber, consecutive to 21ct21
27 months dl rev, retroactive
1 year IID, half price
AODA/DSP

21CF466, Count 5 & 22CF142, Count 1
Sentence withheld, 36 months probation
21CF466, Count 5, 180 days conditional jail, stayed, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving
absolute sobriety, , drugs, norx, shot, drink, sale, para, assess, noact
Apply to Chippewa County Treatment Court, and if accepted, make good faith effort to successfully complete
$518 x2 
DNA

Cash bonds in 22CF116 & 22CF142 to apply to OWI costs.

11:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH R BELCHER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David W. Field in court for JOSEPH R BELCHER. 
Offer received. Resolution reached.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.    (Jail/8382)

9:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David W. Field in court for JOSEPH RUSSELL BELCHER. 
Attorney Field received plea offer today. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant requests bond modification.
Court denies request.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs. Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed. Not to possess syringes unless medically required. Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
